title: basic but good
review: on last minute arrival, they found us a clean room. the bathrooms in India are something you get use too so be prepared to shock the senses.... old school bucket bath... clean hot water clean room. great location just below the Ram Jula bridge river side.

title: extremely great place
review: This is an extremely great place to stay.  it is a very big ashram.  nicely maintained and beautiful view.

title: One of the best place to stay near Ganga
review: I stayed there 3 times. Very lovely place. From the window u can enjoy Ganga view. Down the ashram is ghat where u can take bath or just do little walk. Rooms are clean, hot water always available. But if you want to stay to better book room before, otherwise its always full. Yoga class at  4p.m. Cost 400₹.

title: Spiritual Visit
review: It is a peaceful place to visit and  stay..the atmosphere around is as that of a temple ,mantras and prayers can be heard around it.yoga classes are held here.Its the best place for a peaceful, relaxing  and cheap  place to sta.y

title: All you need for a comfortable stay in Ram Jhula
review: Ganga view room. Air conditioning, hot shower, Television, good size, clean rooms and friendly staff all for IR2000 (cheaper rooms are available)

title: Holy place in Rishikesh
review: One of the oldest Temple in bypass road of Luxman Jhula. A neat and clean environment for saints, yogis ...

title: Wonderful place to stay near Ram Jhula
review: Very close to Ram Jhoola, taxi stand. Rooms have AC, geyser, etc. view of river ganga, right opposite to Parmarth Niketan, beautiful view from the rooms. Peaceful stay. Will recommend this place.

title: Basic rooms, great location
review: Basic rooms, great location. Best location if unable to stay at the Sivananda ashram.There is a wide variety of rooms at this place. All of them are clean and sparsely furnished with hard cotton pads as mattresses.  Prices vary from six hundred to over two thousand rupees per night depending on whether you want private bath , shower , air conditioning , river view. Unfortunately the staff is hard to pin down on prices and room availability. They regularly move people around.  They lock the gates in so you cannot get out before 6 AM.. The estimate classes are very popular. I had room 105 which had a Riverview, balcony and a private bath for 650 per Night.  AC was not necessary in October.  I would not hesitate to stay here again. Virtually all of the guests are Westerners.

title: Great yoga sessions
review: Came here for a few yoga sessions and really enjoyed it. We came for the beginner Hatha class, we also tried the pranayama and the ashtanga classes - enjoyed all of them. The teacher in the pranayama was a bit boring but i enjoyed learning about the breathing techniques.

title: Wonderful stay!
review: Had a pleasure to stay here for 3 weeks in August and September. The view on Ganga from the hotel is just amazing. You can watch an evening Aarti from another side of Ganga! Food was ok but we went to Madras cafe and other places. Also, you can ask the front desk to bring a music teacher for Tabla and Harmonium lessons.

title: value for money
review: This place is very clean and cheap If you are on a budget trip this place is a good option so great value for money

title: Beautiful "
review: we have been to Omkarnand Ashram from 15 th to 21st dec. we were family. It was our firest trip in Ashram. but the experience was good. The Ashram is neat n clean. location is good. food is limited n simple. The staff is polite. The only thing is that you have to carry evrything as its Ashram n not hotel . we also took 3 sessions of yoga. ektaji is conducting the classes beautifully. we enjoyed the classes too. Planning to visit every year. over all good experience. Its reaally value for money.

title: Rishikesh visit in April 2016
review: Rishikesh is about The Ganges.

title: unfriendly staff and sad rooms
review: The rooms are clean but very poorly furnished. In my room there were 2 beds, and I actually had to put the two mattresses one on top of the other, to make a decent one- that was still very hard. My biggest complaint would be the managers who were very unfriendly and not very clear about prices. I booked a room 3 months before and they "downgraded me" to another room. Then I booked a taxi to the airport through them and they told me 800 rupies first, and then once the taxi arrived 850 rupies (I guess the manager figured out he wanted to have some commission, but the official rate is 830,00 outside of the ashram!).

title: Rishikesh Visit
review: we stayed at Omkaranand Ganga Sadan for 2 nights. Rooms are very simple and equipped with only basic amenities i.e. fan, bed, toilet. Please note there is no TV available in Ganga Sadan.

title: I stayed in the visitors house for severak nights
review: Good cleen place on the Ganga banks. Nice view, At the Rishikesh center. It is possible to get meals

title: Nice and simple
review: The place offers serenity and simplistic living. We had our friends staying out here and we accompanied them to see it. Its quite basic but peaceful.

title: Great views
review: Good rooms with big bathrooms too, we had the second floor so we could sit on the balcony looking out at the Ganges.....good place to stay...have to book beforehand...very busy...

title: So calm and peaceful !
review: The Ashram's complex is fairly big. The entire place is so calm, quite and soothing. One can sit in the great Kamakshi Devi temple within the Ashram's complex and meditate for long, without being disturbed. The Ashram staff were very polite and kind. It was such a great experience to meet Swami Vishveswarananda ji,

title: Must visit ashram
review: One of the most well maintained place. Most peaceful and divine. We visited the place 3 times during our stay of 5 days.

title: Omkarananda Ashram – Nice Spiritual Journey
review: This ashram is located on main road and we found it easily. It is old but still managed in a good condition by the owners. Swami ji and Mata ji are the owners of this place: they are cooperative and welcoming. We expected to be served but later came to know it is a place meant for staying and meditating only.

title: An ashram worth visiting
review: This ashram is situated on other side of river Ganga, So we need to cross it. ITS just at a walking distance near the bank of Ganga. THe ambiance of ashram is very serene and peaceful.we found children who were staying and studying there,THE ashram was clean with spiritual atmosphere, We could see many foreigners also.Good experience.

title: best yoga classes with Usha Devi
review: Famous Iyengar yoga teacher Usha Devi hold an evening class in the ashram from September till April. Rooms are cleaned and basic, best ones are downstairs with view on the Ganga, other rooms tend to be noisy as it is near the taxi stand.

title: Wonderful Goddess (Devi )temple...
review: There is a wonderful Goddess (devi) temple at this ashram... there are also beautiful gardens... we recommend the aarthi ceremony in the evenings about 6 PM... but morning visits are quiet and lovely as well

title: Divine Devi in Rishikesh
review: I was living in Rishikesh for two years and enjoyed visiting the Omkarananda Ashram frequently. It is beautifully kept and well managed. The Pandits there perform all the traditional ceremonies and are well trained. The Kamakshi Devi Murti is beautiful and divinely sweet. Definitely go for a visit

title: Calm, seren place.
review: A clam place. U can find young kids staying tHere n studying yoga, Sanskrit n Hindu rituals. Yoga classes are good, but not that much.

title: good puja
review: very nice for attending traditional ceremonies you will find all Hindu gods here and trained pandits perform puja

title: Divinity at its best...
review: We have been visiting this Ashram for more than 10 years. This super clean ashram is for those who wants peace and silence in the divine atmosphere. Just near  Ram Jhula  at the bank of holy Ganges this ashram is situated. Rooms are extremely well maintained... Big...airy. One can sit in the balcony and stare at flowing Ganges for hours. There is no provision for food but number of shops and Chotiwala just next to it. You can also call chotiwala for delivery. Omkarnanda is run by their management committee and Ashram is being run by nice devote Gitaji who takes care of guests. Rooms are airconditiones with immecabely clean bathroom and out of the world view. Not meant for family with small children as u need to maintain serenity... peaceful atmosphere of Ashram. Must visit for those who wants solitude... Peace...

title: spiritual
review: Very nice temple with all hindu prayers which is speciality of rishikesh and best time to visit is morning

title: wow
review: Our Rooms are cleaned and basic, best ones are with view on the Ganga, other rooms tend to be noisy as it is near the taxi shed

title: Serene atmosphere
review: The ashram on the main road makes it a prime spot. Additionally the cleanliness is par excellence and better than any hotel I have seen in rishikesh. Swami ji and mataji, the custodians of the ashram are very helpful and courteous. The only drawback being that there is no service for food except tea/coffee, however that is the main reason for cleanliness of the place. Highly recommended for staying in rishikesh.

title: the best yoga
review: Usha's Eyengar yoga class is legend in Rishikesh, I never stayed at the ashram but I get good reports, it is clean and friendly place.

title: A Big Disappointment
review: I went to Omkarananda Ashram for drop-in classes back in 2011 because I wanted to do Iyengar yoga specifically and I read some ok reviews on this place.

title: Lovely People, great yoga
review: Great Spirits Live here. :)

title: Clean, excellent value for money
review: Book ahead as this place fills fast. We could only get a two night stay and the beginner yoga class was full so I was unable to take a class, sadly. The place is very clean and cheap, in a central location, so great value for money. I'd definitely stay again. Only drawback is the noise of the cars etc.

title: DROP in ridicolous.
review: I know the place is good for Ahtanga courses. I've been told, but my experience for the drop in class was bad.

title: basic but good
review: on last minute arrival, they found us a clean room. the bathrooms in India are something you get use too so be prepared to shock the senses.... old school bucket bath... clean hot water clean room. great location just below the Ram Jula bridge river side.

title: A decent place to stay in.
review: Omkaranda is situated at the side of river ganga. If you opt for the right room you can enjoy the beauty of the river from your window. If you are on a budget trip this place is a good option. Its very near to Ram jhula. The rooms are not great but still they are decent. The tariff is around 1000 for a night.

title: extremely great place
review: This is an extremely great place to stay.  it is a very big ashram.  nicely maintained and beautiful view.

title: One of the best place to stay near Ganga
review: I stayed there 3 times. Very lovely place. From the window u can enjoy Ganga view. Down the ashram is ghat where u can take bath or just do little walk. Rooms are clean, hot water always available. But if you want to stay to better book room before, otherwise its always full. Yoga class at  4p.m. Cost 400₹.

review: It is a peaceful place to visit and  stay..the atmosphere around is as that of a temple ,mantras and prayers can be heard around it.yoga classes are held here.Its the best place for a peaceful, relaxing  and cheap  place to sta.y
